intro: Myrsine popayanensis, commonly known as the Popayán myrsine, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of Colombia and is typically found in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green in color. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by small, berry-like fruits. Myrsine popayanensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
